result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Gerald Shilts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All Counts concurrent.
Defendant has 24 hours to sign up for Probation.
Upon successful completion of Probation Defendant eligible for expungement under 973.015, Defendant to initiate.

  

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
To be determined within 30 days.
Payable through Probation.
Approved by EJL on 3/21/2014. km

-Continue with AODA treatment, including successful drug court participation.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
Defendant to comply with all drug court requirements.

supervisions.notes:
Counts 1, 2 and 3 Concurrent.
Sentence satisfied and Defendant would be released from this file today.
Concurrent with:

Court to enter judgment on monies owed.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob Gerald Shilts

DE appeared to inquire about reducing his monthly pymt back to $25/mo stating he was unaware that it had increased.  The DE was advised that he was mailed an updated Pymt Plan Agmt on 5-09-17 that noted his increased pymt to start 8-15-17.  DE was also advised that he should have been warranted today for non pymt & that he should contact me earlier to avoid WA/WA fees.  I advised the DE that I did not want to decrease his pymt at this time because of the bal due & interest accruing, but that he may contact me closer to 11-15-17 if he has not obtained employment or a paycheck.  DE stated he was searching for employment thru a staffing agency & may possibly start on 10-30-17.  Pymt to remain at $50 & DE to contact me if he needs to defer his pymt for 1 mo while he tries to attain a FT job.  Includes 13CF86, 14CF59, 16CM151, 16CM493. jaf
Final notice sent, due 10-26-17. cah

DE called to inquire about his next pymt due date.  DE was advised that he is technically not due until 8-15-17, but that if he continues just paying the minimum, he will be paying on the bal until 2025.  DE stated he cannot make a pymt until the end of the mo & was advised he is fine to skip this mo since he is pd ahead.  DE stated he will continue to pay ahead if he can. CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:   Alexis S. McKinley, DF ATTY:  Aaron Anton Nelson, DF:  Jacob Gerald Shilts appeared from jail. Includes 13CF86, 13CF309, 13TR4317, 14CF59 and 13CM114. There is an agreement. Def can participate in drug court. Court reviews felony conviction consequences and constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties in 13CF86 ct 2 - possess short barrel shotgun; def pleads guilty. Court uses testimony as factual basis, accepts plea and STAYS adjudication pending full performance of the DJOC. 
13CF309 ct 1 - bail juming; def pleads guilty. Court uses testimony as factual basis, accepts plea and STAYS adjudication pending full performance of the DJOC.
14CF59 as amended, ct 1, 2 and 3 - misdemeanor issuance of worthless checks, 943.24 (1). Def pleads guilty. Court uses reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of the amended counts 1, 2 and 3. 

Court orders in 14CF59 - all counts concurrent: S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- Costs $243.00 for each count. Total of $729.00 payable through probation
- Restitution to be paid through probation. Total to be determined within 30 days. 
- Continue with AODA treatment, inluding successful drug court participation. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
Bond discharged in 14CF59. 
Upon successful completion of probation def eligible for expungement under 973.015. Def to initiate. 
Defendant advised of right to appeal. 
Court reviews Deferred Judgment of Conviction - 3 year term. Felony bails continue during term of DJOC. Def to comply with all drug court requirements. Court approves, orders and signs agreement. 
Defendant approved a payment plan in 13TR4317 of $50.00/mo commencing on May 1, 2014.

Sent hearing on revocation on 13CF86: Counts 3, 4 and 5 - Court orders: 120 days with good time credit for 115 days time served. Def to be release today. 
Defendant has 24 hours to sign up for probation.

filed by Attorney Aaron Nelson. sf
filed by Attorney Aaron Nelson. sf
Preliminary hearing on February 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, First National Community Bank or any of its branches.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO; Lundell, RPR; Staci Lundmark, Clerk; E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Brian T. Smestad for today only,  DF:  Jacob Gerald Shilts appeared from jail.   Includes 14CF59 & 13TR4317. Defendant is on PO hold.    Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. PayH to trail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.
